title: Workshop on Designing and Improving Online Interactive Learning Modules for K-12

context.prior_knowledge: Core principles of instructional design and experience with online education tools
context.additional_context: Targeting pre-service/in-service teachers in smartphone-based limited technological environments, focusing on iterative feedback-driven module design methodologies

learning_goals: Learners can explain the design principles of online interactive modules (clarity, usability, engagement).
Learners can improve a pilot module by applying an iterative design process.
Learners can propose at least three interaction techniques applicable in smartphone environments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
